articles.author: Clare Trainor
articles.description: Former U.S. President Donald Trump is indicted again – the third  indictment in the many legal battles he is facing from state, congressional and federal investigators.
articles.title: Trump’s major legal woes

articles.author: Sarah N. Lynch, Jacqueline Thomsen
articles.description: Efforts to hold Donald Trump criminally responsible for attempting to overturn the 2020 election were gaining steam, as the former U.S. president prepared to face federal charges in a Washington courtroom on Thursday while Georgia state prosecutors looked poised to issue their own charges in the coming weeks.
articles.title: Trump faces deepening legal risks for effort to reverse 2020 election

articles.author: Jack Queen
articles.description: Donald Trump was charged on Tuesday with four felonies over his efforts to undo his 2020 election loss to U.S. President Joe Biden.
articles.title: Explainer: What election interference charges does Trump face and how can he fight them?

articles.author: Jacqueline Thomsen, Sarah N. Lynch, Andrew Goudsward
articles.description: Donald Trump allegedly conspired with six other allies in his failed bid to overturn the results of the 2020 U.S. presidential election, according to an indictment of the former president made public on Tuesday.
articles.title: Explainer: Who allegedly conspired with Trump to overturn the 2020 election?

articles.author: Andrew Goudsward
articles.description: The judge assigned to oversee the federal case against Donald Trump for attempting to overturn the results of the 2020 election has previously ruled against the former president and sharply condemned the Jan. 6, 2021 riot at the U.S. Capitol by his supporters.
articles.title: Factbox: Trump to face familiar judge in criminal case over 2020 election

articles.author: Sarah N. Lynch
articles.description: Jack Smith, the U.S. special counsel who on Tuesday filed a second federal criminal indictment against Donald Trump, has a reputation for winning tough cases against war criminals, mobsters and crooked cops.
articles.title: Who is Special Counsel Jack Smith in the Trump documents case?

articles.author: Jeff Mason, Steve Holland
articles.description: As Donald Trump was being indicted on Tuesday evening for attempting to overturn the 2020 election, the third criminal case against him, U.S. President Joe Biden enjoyed a day at the beach.
articles.title: As Trump was indicted, Biden went to a fish restaurant, 'Oppenheimer' showing

articles.author: Tim Reid
articles.description: Donald Trump's indictment on Tuesday for his alleged role in efforts to overturn his 2020 election defeat will likely fuel his march toward the Republican Party's 2024 presidential nomination, analysts and party strategists say.
articles.title: Indictment could propel Trump closer to 2024 Republican nomination

articles.author: Ernest Scheyder, Eric Onstad
articles.description: Refining rare earths for the green energy transition is hard. Just ask MP Materials and Lynas.
articles.title: Insight: World battles to loosen China's grip on vital rare earths for clean energy transition

articles.author: Mike Stone
articles.description: U.S. officials want to tinker with the mix of chemicals fueling missiles and rockets to gain an advantage in the Pacific by increasing the range of its front line munitions so U.S. forces can operate further away from China.
articles.title: Eyeing China in the Pacific, US studies explosives to make missiles fly further
